judicial review into the police handling of the investigation. The Times investigation cited several former NoW journalists stating that Andy Coulson had "actively encouraged" phone hacking. "In fact", the newspaper continued, an examination based on police records, court documents and interviews with investigators and reporters shows that Britain's revered police agency failed to pursue leads suggesting that one of the country's most powerful newspapers was routinely listening in on its citizens. This was followed by a Channel 4 "Dispatches" programme, in which it was alleged that Andy Coulson had personally listened to hacked messages.
